edu.cmu.al.simulation
Interface LabelingInterface

public interface LabelingInterface

Author:
Shuo Zheng, Zhengxiong Zhang The LabelingInterface interface is used to select instances from the prediction result, label a certain number of instances and send back the result. The interface can simulate the user's behavior, and label instances.

Method Summary
 java.util.List<Instance> labelKInstance(java.util.List<Instance> list, int k)
          The labelKInstance() method can label k instances from the selected instances, and return back the list of the labeled instances.
 java.util.List<Instance> selectKInstance(java.util.List<Instance> list, int k)
          The selectKInstance() method can randomly select k instances from the prediction result.
 java.util.List<Instance> sendBackInstance(java.util.List<Instance> list)
          The sendBackInstance() method can send the labeled instances back to the model.
 

Method Detail

selectKInstance

java.util.List<Instance> selectKInstance(java.util.List<Instance> list,
                                         int k)
The selectKInstance() method can randomly select k instances from the prediction result.

Parameters:
list - The prediction result of the model.
k - The number of selected instances.
Returns:
the selected instances list.

labelKInstance

java.util.List<Instance> labelKInstance(java.util.List<Instance> list,
                                        int k)
The labelKInstance() method can label k instances from the selected instances, and return back the list of the labeled instances.

Parameters:
list - The selected instances from the prediction result.
k - The number of selected instances.
Returns:
the labeled instances list.

sendBackInstance

java.util.List<Instance> sendBackInstance(java.util.List<Instance> list)
The sendBackInstance() method can send the labeled instances back to the model.

Parameters:
list - The list of instances to be returned to the model.
Returns:
the list of returned instances.
